parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Oh, thank the gods you're safe! Where have you been? I was worried something - \|\|\^
- terrible might have happened to you. If it hasn’t come to your attention - \|\|\^
Slide the picture back to the right a little, and set opacity to 0.
We're going to be doing this for every emote! Make sure to wait 20 frames
before the next dialogue or the pictures will insta-change rather than
Yes, I do Idelle, if you had let me finish I was about to inform you all - \|\|\^
- that I have just received word that your father and his men were killed - \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
They killed father! They will pay! \|\|\^
Yes, they will Cedric but not right now! Our defences won't last much longer, - \|\|\^
- we have no option but to flee. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
For split messages, I'd use - at the end of the first,
and - at the beginning of the following

After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture

No, we can’t flee, we need to stay and fight and defend our home. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
Cedric, Mothers right if we stay we will all die we need to go. Besides - \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
I’m not happy with this. Do you know who’s invading us? \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
Well from the words I have received, it appears the armies are from Rinsar - \|\|\^
- although the two sigils they bear are not of their kings. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
Hmm, interesting I will have to look into this. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
Well, do that in your spare time. For now, we need to flee and get to safety. - \|\|\^
- We can go through the castle tunnel. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture

The castle tunnel. There are a series of tunnels that run underneath Haffenden. - \|\|\^
- They're used in the event of danger. \|\|\^
After a small wait (1 second, plus 20 frames for the picture
sliding), make harold look up, wait 20 more frames or so then
Well, that sounds great. However, I think it'd be best that once we are out - \|\|\^
- of the tunnel you, Leya and Idelle should head to Luthania as Idelle - \|\|\^
- is betrothed to Prince Dormato so it would be easy for you three to get - \|\|\^
- accommodation there. Cedric and I will head to Hyde so that we can try and - \|\|\^

I can’t believe what’s happened to the place. My home used to be so different. - \|\|\^
- I remember how things were before this all happened. I remember how we - \|\|\^
- used to play in the courtyards when we were younger, as we got older - \|\|\^
- Idelle and Richard stopped playing with Leya and I. But that day, the day of - \|\|\^
- Father’s return Leya badgered us into playing a game for old times sake. - \|\|\^
- Little did we know that it’d be the last time we’d all be together. \|\|\^
It must be hard for you to look at what’s happened to Haffenden. \|\|\^
It really is. As I got older I used to come down to the marketplace to get - \|\|\^
- away from my siblings, it was refreshing to see how people on the other - \|\|\^
- side lived. It always got to me how I had everything yet it meant nothing - \|\|\^
- whereas they had nothing and it meant everything. Sometimes you would see - \|\|\^
- Idelle out here singing, it’s one of the things she loves to do. \|\|\^
Well I’m not surprised our current predicament doesn’t really seem like a - \|\|\^
Leya was always sneaking around trying to find places to practice fighting. - \|\|\^
- It was funny when she’d get caught. But it never stopped her. Oddly enough, - \|\|\^
- I think it's what Father loved about Leya. He loved all my siblings they met - \|\|\^
- all his expectations and needs. But then there was me who weak, timid and quiet. - \|\|\^
Your father sounds harsh and strict? \|\|\^
Quite the opposite actually, he was warm and loving to his family. I don’t doubt - \|\|\^
- that he loved me. It’s just you could see a difference in the way he was with - \|\|\^
- me compared to the others. You could see how interested in what they were doing - \|\|\^
- but because I wasn’t doing what interested him the same desire wasn’t there. \|\|\^
If he saw me now I’m sure things would be different. Things would have changed if he - \|\|\^
- had made it home the day of the invasion. Mother said I was a lot like him but - \|\|\^
- I guess now I will never know. I think we should go speak to the priest now. \|\|\^
